_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 11:56:45 using v2.1
title: How did NHS staff sickness rates vary by staff type?
analysis_commentary:
Rates of absence vary markedly with staff group. Nursing, midwifery, and health visitor learners have the lowest absence rate (average 1.11% from Jan 10 to Mar 14). However, this group is comprised of students who do not spend all their time rostered onto shifts, and who have markedly different working conditions. Medical and dental staff have the second lowest absence rate (average 1.21% from Jan 10 to Mar 14), and there is almost no seasonal variation.

In contrast, ambulance staff and healthcare assistants have the highest absence rates (6.23% and 6.20% averages from Jan 10 to Mar 14, respectively).
data_source: Health and Social Care Information Centre, NHS Sickness Absence Rates - April 2014
